meanings.sent1: The garbage was so whiffy that I had to hold my nose.
meanings.sent2: The bathroom was whiffy after someone forgot to flush.
meanings.sent3: The whiffy socks in the laundry basket made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The whiffy stench of decay filled the abandoned house.
meanings.sent5: The whiffy smell of rotten eggs lingered in the kitchen.

meanings.sent1: The whiffy cheese made the whole room smell bad.
meanings.sent2: The skunk sprayed a whiffy odor that lingered for hours.
meanings.sent3: The whiffy garbage can attracted flies from all around.
meanings.sent4: The whiffy scent of the sewer wafted through the street.
meanings.sent5: The whiffy aroma of spoiled milk turned my stomach.

meanings.sent1: The old shoes were so whiffy that no one wanted to wear them.
meanings.sent2: The fish market had a particularly whiffy atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The whiffy dog rolled in something foul and needed a bath.
meanings.sent4: The whiffy locker room was enough to make anyone gag.
meanings.sent5: The whiffy scent of wet dog filled the room.
